. not only might but should, have gone up to the sovereign. It was a unique chance to show his devotion to the Emperor 
and he had not made use of it "What have 
I done?" thought he. And he turned round and galloped back to the place where he had seen the Emperor, but there was no one be- yond the ditch now. Only some carts and car- riages were passing by. From one of the drivers he learned that Kutuzov's staff were not far off, in the village the vehicles were going to. Ros- tov followed them
